plants.name: Laburnum anagyroides
plants.description: A deciduous tree known for its stunning, pendulous racemes of bright yellow flowers that create a 'golden chain' effect, commonly used as an ornamental in gardens.
plants.funFact: Despite its beauty, all parts of the Laburnum are toxic if ingested, containing cytisine.

plants.name: Rhododendron spp.
plants.description: A large genus of woody plants, including azaleas, known for their large, showy clusters of bell-shaped flowers. Many species bloom in spring.
plants.funFact: Rhododendrons contain grayanotoxins which can be toxic to humans and animals if ingested.

plants.name: Magnolia sieboldii
plants.description: A deciduous shrub or small tree producing delicate white flowers with purple interiors, prized for its late spring blooming period.
plants.funFact: The Oyama Magnolia was named after the German botanist Philipp Franz von Siebold who studied Japanese flora.

plants.name: Delphinium elatum
plants.description: A tall, stately perennial known for its spiked racemes of blue, purple, pink, or white flowers, popular in temperate garden borders.
plants.funFact: Delphiniums have pollen presented on a structure resembling a dolphin, which is the origin of their name.
